issue.title: `fetch` broken in SSR on Cloudflare Pages
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

Attempting to `fetch` from +page.ts fails. The original error I came across said `Failed to get the 'credentials' property on 'Request': the property is not implemented.`

I posted about this in the Cloudflare Discord and the finger was pointed at https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/pull/5116/files.

In the [original issue](https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/issues/5109) it was stated "At the time this hack was added, the workers runtime didn't support the credentials header set on a request - this looks to be support now" but the Cloudflare people on the Discord don't agree with this.

I made a minimal test repo, although in this case the error is different: `Failed to get the 'mode' property on 'Request': the property is not implemented.`

I haven't tested this when publishing via Wrangler, but they share the same runtime so I would expect it to be broken in that case too.

### Reproduction

**tl;dr**: Publish https://github.com/Deebster/sveltekit-broken-fetch on Cloudflare Pages.

### Full steps

In Github:
* Fork https://github.com/Deebster/sveltekit-broken-fetch

In Cloudflare:
* Go to Pages
* Create a project > Connect to Git
* Select repo
* In "Build settings":
  * Set "Framework preset" to "SvelteKit"
  * Add Environment variable `NODE_VERSION` with value `16`
* Click "Save and Deploy"

In browser:
* View [webpage](https://sveltekit-broken-fetch.pages.dev/).

### Logs

```shell
Error: Failed to get the 'mode' property on 'Request': the property is not implemented.
    at fetch (worker.mjs:1427:24)
    at async fetcher (worker.mjs:1414:22)
    at async load (worker.mjs:603:22)
    at async load_data (worker.mjs:1690:16)
    at async worker.mjs:2496:18
```


### System Info

```shell
Cloudflare Pages
```


### Severity

blocking an upgrade

### Additional Information

Anyone using current version of SvelteKit cannot do `fetch` in SSR on Cloudflare Pages.

body: It looks like cloudflare does not support everything on RequestInit, here's what they have https://developers.cloudflare.com/workers//runtime-apis/request#requestinit  mode and credentials are not on it

Just accessing credentials (or mode i guess) throws an error, so even `req.credentials !== 'omit'` isn't working. It's not just undefined, you cannot use it at all in cloudflare at runtime. Unfortunately it doesn't throw an error while using it in miniflare.

https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/pull/6565/files#diff-3f12c17057d74a7d75f121baea53823d2ebfefa033e5cb834c05f6edca1a847dR81
only workaround i found so far is reverting to 1.0.0-next.469 which is the release before #6565 was introduced (next.470).

@denizkenan This workaround doesn't seem to work on Cloudflare Workers, the runtime  `fetch` doesn't appear to treat the proxy as a `Request` object and does a `toString()`. Which then leads to `fetch` failing with `Fetch API cannot load: [object Object]`

This is particularly hideous if you want to access a `+server.js` helper.
With SSR, you have two choices:

- use Svelte's internal `fetch`: triggers this bug
- use global `fetch`: CF Workers can't reach their own URLs (I guess to avoid infinite recursion), the request 404s.

I'm not aware of any workaround, except downgrading / patching SvelteKit :-(

EDIT: This sucks extra for me personally, because I already have code depending on `handleFetch` being called for internal URLs. I can't downgrade easily.

I made a quick workaround for this. Here's the tl;dr:

```diff
- request.credentials !== 'omit'
+ ('cf' in request ? 'same-origin' : request.credentials) !== 'omit'
```

See https://github.com/tripoutside/sveltekit-cloudflare-workaround-issue6739/commit/2dcb3e3cc0c2178850e617ff5595d8042d91a408

```console
npm i 'https://gitpkg.now.sh/tripoutside/sveltekit-cloudflare-workaround-issue6739/packages/kit?2dcb3e3cc0c2178850e617ff5595d8042d91a408'
```

(Jump through hoops due to https://github.com/npm/npm/issues/2974 and github tarballs always starting from root.)

> My workaround was similar to @denizkenan - add `src/hooks.server.js`:

I've tried this and it does indeed work when using wrangler (miniflare) to run it locally. However it still errors when deployed to Cloudflare Pages, even when using wrangler.

issue.title: FormData works differently on Cloudflare Pages
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

I'm hosting a project on Cloudflare Pages, and in some endpoints, I'm using multipart requests to send files to the server. Behaviour is not the same locally and in production, so I decided to simulate Cloudflare environment with wrangler.

What I found was that the file sent is processed differently in both environments. Locally it is a normal File, however, in production, it is a string. Below I'll attach both outputs from `console.log`

Local:
```
{
  ...
  profilePic: File {},
}
```

Production:

```
{
  ...
  profilePic: '�PNG\r\n' +
    '\x1A\n' +
    '\x00\x00\x00\rIHDR\x00\x00\x00�\x00\x00\x00�\b\x06\x00\x00\x00$`\x0F�\x00\x00\x00\x19tEXtSoftware\x00Adobe ImageReadyq�e<\x00\x00\x1E�IDATx��]\tx\x14E�drN\x12\x12B\x12��\b\x04�p]\x0E�C��\x14\br�? ����!\x1E("*����*,\b\b\x02�\n' + ...
}
```

### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/sveltejs-kit-template-default-blmugs?file=package.json

Some problems when requesting the endpoint but the point is there.
The best way to reproduce this is to run this project twice, one with `npm run dev` and other with `wrangler` (after running `npm run build` with `@sveltejs/adapter-cloudflare`) with this command: `wrangler pages dev --port 3002 .svelte-kit/cloudflare/`

### Logs

_No response_

### System Info

```shell
System:
    OS: macOS 12.6
    CPU: (12) x64 Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-9750H CPU @ 2.60GHz
    Memory: 326.18 MB / 16.00 GB
    Shell: 3.5.1 - /usr/local/bin/fish
  Binaries:
    Node: 18.9.0 - /usr/local/bin/node
    Yarn: 1.22.19 - /usr/local/bin/yarn
    npm: 8.19.1 - /usr/local/bin/npm
  Browsers:
    Chrome: 105.0.5195.125
    Safari: 15.6.1
  npmPackages:
    @sveltejs/adapter-auto: next => 1.0.0-next.80 
    @sveltejs/adapter-cloudflare: ^1.0.0-next.38 => 1.0.0-next.38 
    @sveltejs/kit: 1.0.0-next.450 => 1.0.0-next.450 
    svelte: ^3.50.1 => 3.50.1 
    vite: ^3.1.6 => 3.1.6
```


### Severity

serious, but I can work around it

### Additional Information

I'm using version 450 because of #6739 which makes it impossible for me to use the latest version of SvelteKit. It would be interesting to test this with the latest version of SvelteKit to see if it is still a current problem or was already fixed.

issue.title: [fix] fetch erroring on Cloudflare
issue.body:
Fixes #6739

Ever since #6565 calling `fetch` in a load function fails on Cloudflare (Pages+Workers). This solution checks for the unique `cf` object that Cloudflare sets to bypass properties Cloudflare does not provide, assuming reasonable defaults.

### Please don't delete this checklist! Before submitting the PR, please make sure you do the following:
- [x] It's really useful if your PR references an issue where it is discussed ahead of time. In many cases, features are absent for a reason. For large changes, please create an RFC: https://github.com/sveltejs/rfcs
- [x] This message body should clearly illustrate what problems it solves.
- [ ] Ideally, include a test that fails without this PR but passes with it.

### Tests
- [x] Run the tests with `pnpm test` and lint the project with `pnpm lint` and `pnpm check`

### Changesets
- [x] If your PR makes a change that should be noted in one or more packages' changelogs, generate a changeset by running `pnpm changeset` and following the prompts. All changesets should be `patch` until SvelteKit 1.0

issue.title: bug: sveltekit handleFetch server hook does not work on cloudflare workers
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

Unfortunately, I'm not sure who to raise this issue with. Cloudflare's `Request` object does not implement the `mode` specification which is being leveraged by the fetch implementation that is passed to the `handleFetch` hook.

```
Error: Failed to get the 'mode' property on 'Request': the property is not implemented.
```

This obviously makes this hook completely unusable on cloudflare workers, and therefore, i'm assuming the same is the case on vercel edge functions.

### Reproduction

Implement the `handleFetch` server hook.

### Logs

_No response_

### System Info

```Shell
System:
    OS: macOS 12.3.1
    CPU: (10) arm64 Apple M1 Max
    Memory: 29.72 GB / 64.00 GB
    Shell: 5.8 - /bin/zsh
  Binaries:
    Node: 16.16.0 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v16.16.0/bin/node
    Yarn: 1.22.19 - /opt/homebrew/bin/yarn
    npm: 8.11.0 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v16.16.0/bin/npm
  Browsers:
    Chrome: 106.0.5249.119
    Firefox: 103.0.2
    Safari: 15.4
```


### Severity

serious, but I can work around it

### Additional Information

The `mode` property is checked in the following places...

https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/blob/87b3037bb6fcf574d5d50c91f42cc91d3b97286c/packages/kit/src/runtime/server/fetch.js#L34

https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/blob/87b3037bb6fcf574d5d50c91f42cc91d3b97286c/packages/kit/src/runtime/server/fetch.js#L59`
